evidence: No convex dependency detected in project
No convex/ folder referenced in architecture
No .vercel/ or vercel.json found in pre-code phase
Web app assumes Vercel deployment as reference platform

routingPlan.reason: Next.js/React web SDK (@shakenbake/web) with html2canvas, Canvas annotation, keyboard triggers, and React Provider pattern. Web package is core to MVP.
Expo/React Native SDK (@shakenbake/react-native) with shake triggers, react-native-view-shot, @shopify/react-native-skia annotation, and expo-av audio. Development builds required.

Core plugin system (@shakenbake/core) provides shared types, plugin interfaces, and report builder. Linear GraphQL adapter (@shakenbake/linear) handles issue creation. General backend agent recommended for non-specialized work.
Clerk authentication for Cloud app (apps/cloud) multi-tenant organization support. Specialist agent for auth patterns, scopes, and security model.
Cloud app targets Vercel as reference deployment platform. Multi-package monorepo publish strategy will need Vercel deployment awareness for serverless functions and Blob storage.
Turborepo monorepo coordination, TypeScript base config, shared types (@shakenbake/core), and changesets release workflow. Generic backend agent suitable for build tooling.

notes: FINAL CAPABILITY PLAN — FULL COVERAGE CONFIRMED. ShakeNbake is a pre-code cross-platform bug reporting SDK in specification phase. All mandatory specialist agents available and confirmed during startup: whycode:frontend-web-agent (Next.js, React, html2canvas), whycode:frontend-native-agent (Expo, React Native, Skia), whycode:backend-agent (core types, plugin system, GraphQL adapter, Postgres/Prisma), whycode:backend-auth-agent (Clerk multi-tenant), whycode:deploy-vercel-agent (Vercel serverless). Convex not applicable (Postgres + Prisma used instead). No GitHub integration detected; Vercel CLI status unknown in pre-code phase but Vercel deployment is reference platform. Monorepo (Turborepo) coordinates 7 packages: core, react-native, web, linear, cloud-client, cloud (Next.js), examples. Key architecture: separate frontend SDKs for web and native (distinct platforms, Skia vs html2canvas); single backend for core + GraphQL + Linear; specialist auth for Clerk; specialist deploy for Vercel. Routing rules: frontend-web -> whycode:frontend-web-agent; frontend-native -> whycode:frontend-native-agent; backend/plugin system -> whycode:backend-agent; Clerk auth -> whycode:backend-auth-agent; Vercel deploy -> whycode:deploy-vercel-agent. Selected: completion mode strict (no partial deliverables), max 30 iterations, turbo-teams speed (parallel specialist agents), Linear team Suisios (SUI) for issue tracking. Ready to spawn specialist team.
